workflow.name: Subscription tracker & reminders with GPT-4 nano, Telegram & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
This workflow manages subscription billing reminders and data updates via Telegram. It runs daily at 8:00 AM to check for upcoming due subscriptions, formats relevant information, and sends reminders to users. It also processes user messages for subscription management‚Äîadding, updating, or retrieving billing info‚Äîusing AI-powered natural language understanding.

Main outcomes include automated subscription tracking, timely reminders, and conversational interaction through Telegram, reducing manual tracking efforts and improving billing accuracy.

Automation Benefits
Time & Cost Savings
Manual Process: Several hours/week spent managing subscriptions and reminders manually.
Automated Process: Workflow completes checks, reminders, and data updates in under a minute.
Time Savings: Saves approximately 5 hours weekly, translating to significant productivity gains and cost reduction.

ROI: Automation pays for itself within the first month due to saved labor.
Error Reduction: Minimized manual entry errors, ensuring accurate billing records and timely reminders.

Business Impact
Solves the problem of manual subscription tracking and reminders.
Scales effortlessly as subscription list grows.
Opens new opportunities for proactive customer engagement, personalized messaging, and integrated billing insights.

Setup Guide

Prerequisites
Google Sheets account with subscription data sheet.
OpenAI API key with access to GPT-4.
Telegram bot token with messaging permissions.
Email SMTP setup if email reminders are used.

API Configuration
Google Sheets: Generate OAuth2 credentials, enable Sheets API, and authorize access.
OpenAI: Create API key, set model to GPT-4, and test connectivity.
Telegram: Create bot via BotFather, retrieve token, and set webhook URL.
Webhook URL: Use the provided URL in the Telegram bot settings.

Node-by-Node Setup
OpenAI Chat Model: Enter API credentials, select GPT-4 model.
Google Sheets: Input spreadsheet ID, sheet name, and ensure correct permissions.
Telegram Nodes: Insert chat ID, message parsing, and response formatting.
Schedule Trigger: Confirm cron expression for daily execution.
For AI nodes, test with sample messages to verify formatting and extraction.

Testing & Validation
Run workflow manually.
Confirm data is retrieved, processed, and responses sent.
Verify subscription updates in Google Sheets.
Check Telegram chats for correct message flow.

N8N Documentation References
Google Sheets Node
OpenAI Node
Telegram Node
Schedule Trigger

Maintenance & Troubleshooting

Regular Maintenance (Monthly)
Check API credentials and renew tokens if expired.
Monitor workflow logs for errors.
Review Google Sheets data for consistency.
Update API keys when new versions or permissions are granted.
Verify currency conversion accuracy periodically.

Common Issues & Solutions
Workflow not triggering: check schedule settings and webhook URLs.
Data not updating: verify Google Sheets credentials and permissions.
Incorrect responses: test AI prompt inputs and outputs.
API failures: regenerate API keys or check quota limits.
Reconfigure nodes if external API changes.
Monitoring & Alerts
Set up email or Slack alerts for failures.
Regularly review execution logs.
Track key metrics like successful runs, error rates, and response times.
Support & Escalation
Check n8n logs first for errors.
Export workflow for support if needed.
Use n8n community forums for common issues.
Contact API providers for account-specific problems.
Emergency procedures: restart workflow, regenerate tokens.

Updates & Improvements
Review workflow performance quarterly.
Optimize AI prompts for better accuracy.
Backup workflow configurations before major changes.
Incorporate user feedback for feature enhancements.

nodes.name: OpenAI Chat Model
nodes.notes: Provides the Language Model (GPT-4) for the AI Agent to process natural language requests.

nodes.name: Window Buffer Memory
nodes.notes: Maintains conversation context for each Telegram user session.

nodes.name: Format Response
nodes.notes: Formats the AI Agent's response for sending back to Telegram.

nodes.name: Send Telegram Response
nodes.notes: Sends the AI Agent's response back to the user via Telegram.

nodes.name: Daily 8AM Check
nodes.notes: Triggers daily at 8:00 AM to check for subscriptions due within 3 days.

nodes.name: Read Subscriptions
nodes.notes: Reads all subscription data from Google Sheets to check for upcoming due dates.

parameters.content:
# ü§ñ Bill Agent

The heart of the subscription management system:
- Processes natural language requests
- Connects to Google Sheets via sub-workflow tool
- Maintains conversation memory per user
- Handles CRUD operations on subscription data

**Key Features:**
- Add/update/delete subscriptions
- List active/inactive subscriptions
- Calculate due dates and currency conversions
- Provide spending summaries

# üìÖ Daily Reminder System

Automated daily checks at 8:00 AM:
- Reads all subscription data
- Filters subscriptions due within 3 days
- Sends email reminders with formatted content
- Includes totals and detailed breakdown

**Setup Required:**
- Configure Google Sheets credentials
- Set up SMTP for email sending
- Update user email address
- Ensure Google Sheets has proper formulas for 'Due In' column

nodes.name: Any Subscriptions Due?
nodes.notes: Checks if there are any subscriptions due within 3 days that need email notification.

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets
Send Telegram Response1
nodes.notes: Sends the AI Agent's response back to the user via Telegram.

values.content:
=You are a subscription reminder assistant. Format the following subscription bills into a clear, concise Telegram message.

Include:
- Total number of bills due
- Each bill's name, amount in Peso, plan type, and exact due date
- Use emojis for better readability
- Keep it under 400 characters for Telegram

Format example:
üö® BILLS DUE SOON (3 bills)

üí≥ Netflix Pro - ‚Ç±890.45
üìÖ Due: Jan 26, 2025 (2 days)

üéµ Spotify Premium - ‚Ç±556.45  
üìÖ Due: Jan 28, 2025 (4 days)

Make it urgent but friendly.

nodes.name: Smart Bill Manager
nodes.notes: The core AI Agent that processes user requests and manages subscription data through natural language.

options.systemMessage:
=ROLE: Smart Bill Manager
You are an efficient subscription billing assistant that collects complete information in a single interaction to save tokens and time.

CORE DATA REQUIREMENTS (Collect ALL 6 fields)
When a user mentions ANY subscription/bill, immediately extract and collect:

1. Bill Name: Extract service name only (e.g., "YouTube" from "YouTube Premium")
2. Amount: ONLY convert if NOT in USD. USD amounts go directly through.
3. Plan: Extract plan/tier (e.g., "Premium", "Family", "Pro", "Basic")
4. Start Date: When subscription began (YYYY-MM-DD format)
5. Billing Cycle: "Monthly", "Yearly", or "Weekly"

OPTIONAL:
6. Status: Always  to "Active" unless user specifies "Inactive"
7. Card Used: Only collect if user mentions (last 4 digits)

CRITICAL RULES

Currency Conversion (SMART LOGIC)
- IF amount contains "$" OR "USD" ‚Üí Use directly, NO search needed
- IF amount contains ‚Ç±, ‚Ç¨, ¬£, ¬•, etc. ‚Üí THEN search for conversion
- Examples:
  ‚úÖ "$15.99" ‚Üí Use directly as "$15.99"
  ‚úÖ "15.99 USD" ‚Üí Use directly as "$15.99"
  üîç "‚Ç±189" ‚Üí Search "189 PHP to USD" ‚Üí "$3.45"
  üîç "‚Ç¨12" ‚Üí Search "12 EUR to USD" ‚Üí "$13.20"

Efficient Data Collection
- Extract ALL available information from first message
- Only ask for missing required fields
- If user provides partial info, intelligently extract what you can and ask for the rest

Bill Name Intelligence
- Extract service name from plan names:
  - "YouTube Premium" ‚Üí Bill Name: "YouTube", Plan: "Premium"
  - "Netflix Family Plan" ‚Üí Bill Name: "Netflix", Plan: "Family"
  - "Spotify Free" ‚Üí Bill Name: "Spotify", Plan: "Free"

CONVERSATION EXAMPLES

Input: "$15.99/mo. Next due 13 of august. Youtube premium plan"

Your Response:
‚úÖ **YouTube Premium - Ready to Add!**

From your message, I have:
‚úÖ Bill Name: YouTube
‚úÖ Plan: Premium  
‚úÖ Amount: $15.99 (already in USD)
‚úÖ Billing Cycle: Monthly (from "/mo")

I need 2 more details:
‚ùì **Start Date**: When did you first subscribe? (YYYY-MM-DD)
‚ùì **Status**: Active or Inactive? (I'll assume Active)

Once you provide the start date, I'll add it immediately!

Input: "‚Ç±189/mo. Next due 13 of august. Youtube premium plan"

Your Response:
I'll add YouTube Premium! Let me convert that amount first.

[Use search: "189 PHP to USD"]

‚úÖ **YouTube Premium - Ready to Add!**

From your message, I have:
‚úÖ Bill Name: YouTube
‚úÖ Plan: Premium  
‚úÖ Amount: $3.45 (converted from ‚Ç±189)
‚úÖ Billing Cycle: Monthly (from "/mo")

I need 2 more details:
‚ùì **Start Date**: When did you first subscribe? (YYYY-MM-DD)
‚ùì **Status**: Active or Inactive? (I'll assume Active)

POST-UPDATE BEHAVIOR
After EVERY successful addition/update, automatically show the 3 nearest due dates from their subscription list.

SEARCH TOOL USAGE
Use search ONLY for:
- Non-USD currency conversions: "189 PHP to USD converter"
- Pricing verification: "YouTube Premium price 2025 USD" (only if needed)
- Plan confirmation: "Netflix plans and pricing 2025" (only if needed)

ERROR PREVENTION
- Never search if amount is already in USD (contains $ or USD)
- Never save incomplete records
- Always confirm plan extraction is correct
- Default Status to "Active" unless specified
- Extract maximum data from first message to minimize back-and-forth

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet in Google Sheets
Telegram Message Received
nodes.notes: Triggers when any message is received via Telegram bot

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
